content.description: Climbs the shallow dihedral to the left of Pee Wee's. Fun climbing on great holds. At the top, route meets up with Pee Wee's.
content.location: In MW's topo, it's located in side canyons. Route is next to Pee Wee's.

content.description: Small route with a tricky starting move. Once you get past it, the climb drastically lowers to a 5.5 or lower. This is more like a V3 boulder problem that can be top rope protected.
content.location: When going around the north side of the tower, it will be the tiny face to the left of the cave, right before you get to PeeWee's

content.description: Easy face climbing with some good pockets
content.location: Just left of the easy nose sport route.

content.description: A classic!  Consistently very steep, PeeWee's is one of the best lines in the park and follows a series of roofs and overhangs for 40-45 feet.  There are plenty of jugs and horizontal cracks right where you need them, just follow the chalk.
content.protection: Plenty of bolts up top.  Bring some long 20'+ slings because most bolts are a ways back.
content.location: PeeWee's is on the North face of the tower.  It's the huge roof over your head after you pass through the tunnel/cave.

content.description: Route just left of the roof with a tiny bit overhanging, but the name is overestimating the route.
content.location: Left of the roof variation route

content.description: Easy face climbing with plenty of pockets and big crimps
content.location: Find the two furthest west bolts on the gator head wall side of the tower and build an anchor there. Where the rope lands on that wall is about where the route is.

content.description: Slightly tricky start, easy middle, then slightly tricky end. Stay right of the mid-wall arete formation
content.location: Just right of the 'a' route on this wall and stay right of the arete in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Face climbing that starts directly under the dark hole in the gator head wall. From here, you head straight up.
content.location: From the Easy Nose, it's right around the corner.
Left of Overhang route and right before small canyon entrance

content.description: Easy slab nose that is great for new climbers or first leads. Easy start and finish, with the crux being the middle third or so, which has a few less good holds than the start and finish.
content.protection: 4 bolts to the top. Has chains with rap rings bolted at the top. Can top rope, but the scramble to the top of the tower is sketchy.
content.location: Go down the stairs and turn left. This is the nose that protrudes out of the first tower on the right. It should be the first climb you approach on the right side of the canyon, if you are coming from the stairs. Only bolted climb on that wall.

content.description: Fun small roof problem on the east side of the cave tower.  It is found just to the left of the narrow slot cave that runs through the middle of the tower.

Home to the best roofs in the park, including the area classic "PeeWee's".  This area gets more sun and has fewer climbers due to the harrowing approach for the anchors. 

  To get to the anchors: The safest approach to the anchors is to lead "Easy Nose" on the eastern-most side, which is nicely protected by four bolts up to a set of rappel chains. 

  On the topo map found at the park visitor center this area contains routes from the "First Overhang" and "Side Canyons" area.
